results.title: Hand of Adam
results.creator_credit: Murray Grigor, Viz Ltd and Films of Scotland
results.brief_description: Shows the work of Robert Adam, the Scottish architect of the 18th century. His designs were mostly inspired by Ancient Rome and Greece, having studied these styles in Italy. Many examples of his fine work are shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Murray Grigor, Viz Ltd and Films of Scotland

results.title: Hana-Bi = Fireworks
results.creator_credit: Takeshi Kitano, Takio Yoshida, Yasushi Tsuge, Masayuki Mori and Office Kitano
results.brief_description: ‘Hana-bi’ might of launched director and star Takeshi Kitano onto the international film scene but the prolific film maker (who also goes by the name ‘Beat’ Takeshi) was already a star in his home country where he wears many creative hats. Besides feature films he works extensively in television, is also known as a comedian and has now added painter to his impressive resume. (Kitano’s artwork is on display throughout Hana-bi) Kitano’s genius lies in the radically contrasting rhythm of narrative and style. One minute a poignant and understated drama about a cop (Kitano) and his terminally ill wife (Kayoko Kishimoto), the next an excessively violent police film, punctuated by bloody scenes of mayhem. The two radically different strands are seamlessly bought together by Kitano’s restrained direction, the mosaic editing style, quirky characterisations and the fine musical score by Joe Hisaishi. In Japanese with English subtitles Cast also includes Ren Osugi and Susumu Terajima. (Awards: Golden Lion 1997 Venice Film Festival)

results.title: Hamster from Hamsterdam
results.creator_credit: Z Drakulic, W. Reiner and ACI Films
results.brief_description: An animated film using three-dimensional objects for the characters. A song tells the story of the hamster searching for a pair of gloves to keep his hands warm. Designed to encourage story telling and rhyme making by children.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Z Drakulic, W. Reiner and ACI Films

results.title: Hams that couldn't be cured
results.creator_credit: Walter Lantz, United World Films and Castle Films
results.brief_description: Animated film telling the “Three Little Pigs” tale from the Big Bad Wolf’s point of view, with the pigs as tough jazzing beatniks. Similar to the Warner cartoon “Three Little Bops”.
